tool.name: Merging paired-end Illumina reads (SeqPrep)
tool.description: Merge and Trim Adapter Sequences from Paired-End Illumina Reads
tool.command: SeqPrep -f '${input1}' -r '${input2}' #if $output_all -1 '${output1}' -2 '${output2}' #end if #if $merge_reads -s '${merged}' #end if #if $adapter_a -A '${adapter_a}' #end if #if $adapter_b -B '${adapter_b}' #end if #if $quality_cutoff -q $quality_cutoff #end if #if $min_length -L $min_length #end if

param.label: Output All Reads
param.name: output_all
param.help: If selected, output both individual and merged reads. Otherwise, output only merged reads if 'Merge Reads' is selected.

tool.help:
**SeqPrep**
SeqPrep is a program to merge paired end Illumina reads that are overlapping into a single longer read. It can also trim adapter sequences from reads.
**Usage**
Select the input FASTQ files for the first and second reads. Optionally, provide custom adapter sequences, a quality score cutoff, and a minimum length for trimmed or merged reads. If merging is enabled, the merged output will be provided in addition to the individual read outputs.
**Outputs**
The output will be provided in gzipped FASTQ format.
